# Software Engineering Interview Scoring Rubric

## Overview
The rubric provides a standardized way to evaluate candidates across four core competency areas: Technical Skills, Problem Solving, Communication, and Culture Fit. Each area is scored from 1 (Below Expectations) to 5 (Exceeds Expectations).

## Scoring Matrix
| Competency | 1 – Below Expectations | 2 – Needs Improvement | 3 – Meets Expectations | 4 – Strong | 5 – Exceeds Expectations |
|------------|------------------------|------------------------|------------------------|-----------|---------------------------|
| Technical Skills | Lacks fundamental knowledge; cannot write functional code. | Basic syntax understood; limited problem‑solving. | Writes correct code for standard problems; uses appropriate data structures. | Demonstrates deep knowledge; writes efficient, clean code. | Expert‑level; anticipates edge cases, writes optimal solutions, mentors others. |
| Problem Solving | Unable to break down problems; no clear approach. | Attempts but often stalls; needs guidance. | Systematically works through problems; reaches correct answer. | Shows creativity; optimizes solution; minimal guidance needed. | Innovates novel approaches; can solve ambiguous problems quickly. |
| Communication | Provides unclear or incomplete explanations. | Explains basics but lacks detail; occasional jargon. | Communicates solution clearly; articulates trade‑offs. | Engages with interviewers; asks clarifying questions; explains rationale well. | Excellent articulation; teaches concepts; adapts communication style to audience. |
| Culture Fit | Shows little alignment with company values. | Partial alignment; some reservations. | Demonstrates good fit with core values. | Strong alignment; actively promotes inclusive culture. | Embodies and champions company culture; mentors others in cultural values. |

## Usage Guidelines
- Evaluate each competency independently.
- Total score is the sum of the four competency scores (minimum 4, maximum 20).
- Use the rubric as a discussion aid; allow for qualitative notes alongside numeric scores.

*Document version: 2024‑07‑15*
---
